meta.title: FAQ - Public Prep

meta.name: google-site-verification

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection1847 fsHasTheme2 district

li.a: PrePrep: the Joan Ganz Cooney Early Learning Program
Girls Prep Lower East Side Elementary
Girls Prep Lower East Side Middle
Reject the soft bigotry of low expectations clone- part 2
Reject the soft bigotry of low expectations
If not us, who will make humans human?
How the emergence of the white underclass could improve education for all
White kids can't read, either (and other unacknowledged truths)
The diminishing significance of racism and poverty in education reform
From "16 and Pregnant" to "Teen Mom" to "30 Something Grandma"
Who's your daddy? A question for education reformers
Should Schools Promote the Success Sequence? Why or Why Not?
"Lord knows I love my kids": Poverty, family formation, and the future of education reform
Poverty, family formation, and the future of education reform clone
Education 20/20 Speaker Series: Michael Barone And Ian Rowe
Overcoming Adversity, Not Leaning On It

div.div: Public Prep is the nation’s only non-profit network that exclusively develops exceptional, tuition-free PreK and single-sex elementary and middle public schools.
Public Prep is comprised of 3 tuition-free single-sex public charter schools across 5 campuses that are open enrollment and can only be entered via a random lottery.

li.a: Girls Prep Lower East Side Elementary
Girls Prep Lower East Side Middle
What is the status of Saturday Academy?

h2.a: What is the status of Saturday Academy?

div.p: Effective 3/13, all after-school programming and weekend activities are canceled until further notice.

Per the Governor's announcement on 4/6/2020, schools across New York State, including Public Prep Academies, will remain closed through at least April 29th. We will continue to update you as additional decisions are made.

li.a: What is the status of the NYS Exams?
Are 8th graders not taking the regents? If not, will they still receive the credit for the classes?

h2.a: What is the status of the NYS Exams?

div.p: All New York State Exams have been cancelled due to school closures.

h2.a: Are 8th graders not taking the regents? If not, will they still receive the credit for the classes?

div.p: On 4/6/20, the Governor confirmed that all Regents exams scheduled for this spring will be canceled. We will follow guidance on providing credit for the classes.

li.a: What is the status of Family Teacher Conferences? How will they happen now that school is closed?
The HR department at my job is requesting letter confirming school closures. Can you provide?
What do I do if I am not receiving Kinvo messages or communication from my teacher?
The mayor shared that he doesn't foresee schools opening back up for this school year. What does that mean for Public Prep?

h2.a: What is the status of Family Teacher Conferences? How will they happen now that school is closed?

div.p: More information on our plan coming soon!

h2.a: The HR department at my job is requesting letter confirming school closures. Can you provide?

div.p: You can find the confirmation letter here.

h2.a: What do I do if I am not receiving Kinvo messages or communication from my teacher?

div.p: Make sure your family contact information is updated by emailing Public Prep at closures@publicprep.org.

h2.a: The mayor shared that he doesn't foresee schools opening back up for this school year. What does that mean for Public Prep?

div.p: Public Prep will follow the guidance and direction of the New York City Department of Education (NYCDOE).

li.a: Where can I access breakfast and lunch for my scholar during the closure?

h2.a: Where can I access breakfast and lunch for my scholar during the closure?

div.p: Please see our COVID resources page for the latest information on food services, including grab and go locations throughout NYC, and distribution times at our Public Prep Academies through our food vendor, Red Rabbit.

li.a: How will my child receive SPED services?
How should my scholar be spending their time throughout the day?
How do I log in to Clever/Iluminate/Dreambox/Razkids?

h2.a: How will my child receive SPED services?

div.p: Starting on March 23rd, IEP services will be provided virtually. For details, please contact your school's Assistant Director of Student Support.
All scheduled IEP meetings will take place by phone or video conference

h2.a: How should my scholar be spending their time throughout the day?

div.p: We have included sample scholar schedules on our website. Find them here!

p.meta: Beginning Monday, April 6th, we will utilize Google Classroom to track attendance. Everyday, all scholars are expected to log into Google Classroom by entering their school email address and password via the google sign-in page. Logging in will count as attendance for the day.

div.p: Scholars are expected to log in every single day to at least say they are present. Those that do not have internet connectivity or access to an internet-based device should alert their scholar’s teacher as soon as possible.

h2.a: How do I log in to Clever/Iluminate/Dreambox/Razkids?

div.p: There are demo videos included on our website here. Check back as we plan to add more!

li.a: What if my family doesn't have access to internet?
What if I only have one device and multiple students in my home?
What if I don't have access to a printer?

h2.a: What if my family doesn't have access to internet?

ul.li: Spectrum: Offering free public hotspot access as well as 60 day 100 Mbps broadband internet. Call (844) 488-8395.
Comcast: Offering free two months of internet service
Altice USA: Altice USA is offering their advantage 30 Mbps broadband solutions for free for 60 days to any new customer households. Call (866)-200-9522
TMobile and Metro By Tmobile: Providing subscribing for the next 60 days unlimited smartphone data plus 20GB of mobile hotspot/Tethering (Apple/Android)
AT&T: Keeping public wifi hotspots for free access
Sprint Wireless: Providing subscribing for the next 60 days unlimited smartphone data plus 20GB of mobile hotspot/Tethering

h2.a: What if I only have one device and multiple students in my home?

div.p: That is no problem! Our remote learning plan does not require scholars to use tech throughout the entire day, so one family will be able to share one device.

h2.a: What if I don't have access to a printer?

div.p: The great news is that scholars do not need to print the remote learning academic work to complete! They can read the assignments in the packets and write answers down in a notebook or on paper, and submit responses in Illuminate when necessary.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window
